intro: Schubertia capensis, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, dandelion-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and branching. Schubertia capensis is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in full sun.
